fields.Title of Presentation: “The Basque Cultural Magazine Euzko-Gogoa: The Transoceanic Basque Will.”
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: the 3rd international congress of the World Literature Association on 'World Literatures and the Global South'
fields.Sponsoring Organization: University of Sydney and the World Literature Association
fields.Description/Abstract:
The paper presented by professor Gandarias Beldarrain was titled “The Basque Cultural Magazine Euzko-Gogoa: The Transoceanic Basque Will.”  It examined the political and aesthetic positions of the cultural magazine Euzko-Gogoa (Basque Will, 1950-1960) published in the Basque exile, by focusing on the literary work produced in its pages and in the network of Basque intellectuals created in exile. 
 
She explained how the network created through the various publications was able to save and rebuild the beloved motherland through these Basque individuals’ language, euskara. Euskara became the cohesive element to rebuild the defeated Basque culture and nation during the dark years of the dictatorship in Spain. The network of writers allowed for the creation of an imagined community and a place of dialogue to develop a national consensus. The magazine became the space for the Basque identity to be debated and redefined. In summary, the paper showed that  the Basque culture in exile was shaped and formed  – by its traumatic history and multilingual and transnational population.
